## Description {#details}

Legacy symbol resolution interface.

Definition at line 401 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/jitsymbol-h">JITSymbol.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### findSymbol() {#a2612c868eb773faf53d42254da895290}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual JITSymbol llvm::LegacyJITSymbolResolver::findSymbol (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::string &amp; Name)</>}>
This method returns the address of the specified function or variable.

It is used to resolve symbols during module linking.

If the returned symbol&#39;s address is equal to ~0ULL then <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> will skip all relocations for that symbol, and the client will be responsible for handling them manually.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/jitsymbol-h/#l00432">432</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/jitsymbol-h">JITSymbol.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### findSymbolInLogicalDylib() {#a7380b8beb758e62402b0817f6d5adfcb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual JITSymbol llvm::LegacyJITSymbolResolver::findSymbolInLogicalDylib (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::string &amp; Name)</>}>
This method returns the address of the specified symbol if it exists within the logical dynamic library represented by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitsymbolresolver">JITSymbolResolver</a>.

Unlike findSymbol, queries through this interface should return addresses for hidden symbols.

This is of particular importance for the Orc JIT APIs, which support lazy compilation by breaking up modules: Each of those broken out modules must be able to resolve hidden symbols provided by the others. Clients writing memory managers for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a> can usually ignore this method.

This method will be queried by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> when checking for previous definitions of common symbols.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/jitsymbol-h/#l00424">424</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/jitsymbol-h">JITSymbol.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getResponsibilitySet() {#a70654ce07c092ce4e460bb98d10319f6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; JITSymbolResolver::LookupSet &gt; LegacyJITSymbolResolver::getResponsibilitySet (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitsymbolresolver/#a487abfdc466598f156d5398ae986c6f9">LookupSet</a> &amp; Symbols)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Performs flags lookup by calling findSymbolInLogicalDylib and returning the flags value for that symbol.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/jitsymbol-h/#l00410">410</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/jitsymbol-h">JITSymbol.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/jitsymbol-cpp/#l00149">149</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/jitsymbol-cpp">JITSymbol.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lookup() {#aadf85c83250f0a519c4e6c498dd91a15}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LegacyJITSymbolResolver::lookup (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitsymbolresolver/#a487abfdc466598f156d5398ae986c6f9">LookupSet</a> &amp; Symbols, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitsymbolresolver/#a01f534cbe65344148ec2986691ff632a">OnResolvedFunction</a> OnResolved)</>}
